sentences.sContent: We got arrested once, for singing bawdy songs in a cemetery.
sentences.sContent_eng: We got arrested once, for singing bawdy songs in a cemetery.
sentences.sCn: 我们曾经因为在公墓唱下流歌曲而被拘留过一次。

sentences.sContent: It was not a night in which any credible witness was likely to be straying about a cemetery, so the three men who were there, digging into the grave of Henry Armstrong, felt reasonably secure.
sentences.sContent_eng: It was not a night in which any credible witness was likely to be straying about a cemetery, so the three men who were there, digging into the grave of Henry Armstrong, felt reasonably secure.
sentences.sCn: 一个正直可信的人是不会在这样的一个夜晚里在墓地里游荡的，所以，理所当然，正在那里挖掘亨利?阿姆斯特朗墓的三个人是不会感到有所顾忌的。

remMethod.val: 彗星(comet)撞地球， 人类的坟墓(cemetery)

trans.tranOther: a piece of land, usually not belonging to a church, in which dead people are buried
